etymologies: early 17th century: from obsolete common ‘to exercise right of common’ + -able

definitions: (of land) allowed to be jointly used or owned

examples.text: the idea of having rights on the commonable land

shortDefinitions: allowed to be jointly used or owned

definitions: (of an animal) allowed to be pastured on public land

examples.text: these Acts exclude the deer and commonable cattle

shortDefinitions: (of animal) allowed to be pastured on public land
